div1.ab: Miss Mildred Piper 809 North Hastings Ave Hastings Nebraska

div1.p: I would not flame you if you just ignored this letter altogether, But I hope to goodness you don't, you will see by the above address that I am away off up here and you will guess why since you knew that Grace had come to Buffalo to attend School of Library science, Did I tell you that last June she graduated from the Library course and had a position in the Buffalo Public Library before she had finished so now she has a good position in the and then her insistence I am here with her to spend the winter, or until March 1st having reviled my home furnished until then. I think I will go by way of Mineapolis home and see Lulu. I want so much to see mother again she is living now with

my sister in Grinnell Iowa. Grace and I are doing light house keeping, we have quite a large Room that serves as bed-room and living room and a good sized room that is both. Kitchen and dining room, with hot and cold water gas range the rooms are both heated, and we have the privilege of doing our own washing and ironing in the basement which is fitted out with stationary Tubes with hot and cold water and a drying room. So you see I am being very much of a lady Grace and I have been to see Niagara Falls. to-East Aurora, the town that Elbert Hubbard made famous with his wonderful Roy Croft shops. We were thru them and they are wonderful and I did so want to get somethings while there but the prices are prohibitive at least to me. Such wonderful hammered brass and copper, tooled leather carved wood metal things of various kinds, beauti-hand carved furniture fancy bound books. And oh so many other things, I can't mention them all, but I came away with a dozen post cards, we have been to some

good movies and Vodville, Saw "The thief of Bagdad" in movie, perfectly wonderful next was the "Covered Wagon." I go quite often to the Art galery, say my dear I could just wander around there forever and I spend lots of time browsing around the Library, I often go down in the after noon and stay until six o clock when we go to some cafeteria and have our suppers and then to some show and Then home. Can you imagine me leading such a disolute life? Well I am and what is more our enjoying it immensely. We had a trip across lake Eri into Canada. Canada looked very much like our United States, except the houses and barns, I did not even "smell the blood of an Englishman," I went to a crysmthemum show last week mercy! I saw cryanthmums as big as a baby's head an two big show rooms of them, all color wonderful! sometime when I see you again I'll tell you all about it I can't write it I do get lonesome for my baby down in the Ozarks. John has been away

on a lecture trip and has just returned I had a letter from him just after he was at Laurel Nebr. He said he saw Miss Fish there and that she talked just as fast as she could asking question about us all included, I wish he could get to your town once. I had a letter from Mrs. Bailey and she asked about you too Mrs. White is very delicate Mrs. Bailey seemed worried about her. Please write me soon and tell me all you have him doing remember me to all your people Especially to your good father and mother.
Poor Mrs. Brown is thinking of going back to teaching again. She seems to be unable to make ends meet. Ruth is in High School Mrs. Ward is still teaching.
Dear girls you know I love you Ever tho I have been so mean about writing and please heap of fere on my head by writing soon
